data.text:
Gender equality contributes to lasting peace.
We can all help support women's full & effective participation in decision-making at all levels, including in peace & political processes.
@UNPeacekeeping explains how: https://t.co/2Lf3FEmjzA

https://t.co/k9oTfiOmv4

Nurses, doctors... and facts are lifesavers. 

More than ever we need facts. 
More than ever we need press freedom. 

Monday is #WorldPressFreedomDay. https://t.co/llv0ovkEq9 https://t.co/nxe3R6o0Jc

"We decided what more can we do instead of just sitting on the sidelines and complaining." 

Meet @UNEP Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee. She's a Kenyan engineer who is turning trash into cash by recycling plastic waste into building materials. https://t.co/aijwzQsuUb https://t.co/43TOZdYSbP

"The global challenges we have faced during the #COVID19 pandemic underline the critical role of reliable, verified & universally accessible information." 

-- @antonioguterres on Monday's #WorldPressFreedomDay. https://t.co/fg8ThSMIYk https://t.co/F7fq0U7uE6

Seeking asylum is a fundamental human right for people fleeing violence, persecution, war or disaster at home.

More from @refugees on the right to seek asylum: https://t.co/rtosk22X9s https://t.co/PqR0LmXPED

Vaccines are not being shared fairly around the world.

81% of vaccines have been given in higher income countries, compared with just 0.3% in lower income countries 

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/dRwjNduAkF

When Holocaust distortion is left unchallenged, it can lead to Holocaust denial, antisemitism, conspiracy myths & dangerous forms of nationalism.

We can all do our part to #ProtectTheFacts about the Holocaust. https://t.co/uJ3Y1FoTkg https://t.co/XrwUnGmZjD

The world has never faced a crisis like #COVID19 & it's never been more urgent to show support for the global solidarity response fund. 

#OnlyTogether can we bring the pandemic to an end. https://t.co/pnecH4zAV2 https://t.co/FwtwYs9kcl

During these times of high-stress and uncertainty amid the #COVID19 pandemic, it's important to look after yourself - and others. 

Stay safe and stay positive. We are in this together -- and we will get through this together. 

🎨: @aysegulaltinel https://t.co/WfY1YjBjfd

Tuna's popularity has resulted in it being overfished in many places.

Ensuring the tuna you eat is sustainably managed can help protect fish stocks & their surrounding ecosystems.

More on Sunday's #WorldTunaDay. https://t.co/XvOaw5Mfkr #GlobalGoals https://t.co/4nSwJb7lof

"This virus of lies infects real people- and when real people are infected, they become impervious to facts."

-- @mariaressa, 2021 @UNESCO / Guillermo Cano World Press Freedom Prize winner, on the need to counter misinformation amid the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/ZMk6awesPZ https://t.co/eLowfNgJ2K

The overwhelming demand for tuna poses a threat to fish stocks & their surrounding ecosystems.

On Sunday's #WorldTunaDay, see what effect your choice of seafood has on achieving a sustainable future. https://t.co/XvOaw63QJ1 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/Lu5Rxaf9mB

Inequalities resulted in missed global AIDS targets in 2020, allowing the pandemic to grow in many regions & countries. 

Yet, ending AIDS as a public health threat by 2030 is still within reach, says @antonioguterres. https://t.co/lECkThFiZM

As India and other countries grapple with a surge of #COVID19 cases, the world is reminded that we must all work together to save lives.

#OnlyTogether can we overcome this pandemic. https://t.co/lsfaV8EZsU https://t.co/wUpr09SyLJ

3⃣4⃣ million people are one step away from famine, the most disastrous form of prolonged hunger.

Famine is preventable, but only if we act now.

Spread the word & help @WFP #FightFamine: https://t.co/ILrwW4qx4r https://t.co/cwPc0LWPTW

"Field visits are very important for me because it's part of my job to unmute the voices of survivors."

In the latest episode of Awake At Night, UN special representative for @endrapeinwar Pramila Patten talks about her work with survivors of conflict-related sexual violence.

Myanmar: Turmoil following military coup, coupled with impact of #COVID19, could result in up to 25 million people – nearly half of the country’s population –  living in poverty by early next year, according to new @UNDP report. https://t.co/O8dQ0RvW8v

China assumes the presidency of the Security Council for the month of May. 

Follow @Chinamission2un for updates. https://t.co/NaXBn66Wda https://t.co/F5QUBa2m9A

"Solidarity is key to our common survival and prosperity"

-- @ILO chief @GuyRyder urges everyone to join forces for a world of work with justice and dignity for all. https://t.co/yuiRbaTdYg #MayDay https://t.co/AFj2Vz64Eo

Vaccines are a critical tool in the battle against #COVID19. There are currently four types being used around the world.

Here’s how these #VaccinesWork. ⬇️ 

Help share verified information that saves lives: https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/RGl5eM5HoU

#VaccinesWork, are safe & prevent millions of deaths each year.

As World Immunization Week comes to an end, the UN is highlighting the importance of equitable access to vaccines to overcome the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/bBqM7ACnC4
#FBF to 2019 when cast & crew of @HandmaidsOnHulu visited UNHQ to hear from UN experts about themes explored in the TV show. Watch to see what happened. #HandmaidsTale https://t.co/M9fMJ5tGQK

Watch LIVE as some of the 🌎’s greatest jazz musicians come together on Friday's #JazzDay for a unique virtual concert that celebrates the power of music to unite & strengthen humankind. 

https://t.co/hS1EH8MGdl

"With the entire UN family, I stand in solidarity with the people of India as they face a horrific #COVID19 outbreak."

-- @antonioguterres says the UN stands ready to step up support to India. https://t.co/nMkeRC7aqv https://t.co/uTwyd1DMa0

"I know intimately well the power of music - especially jazz - to bring people together & make a positive difference in the world."

On Friday's #JazzDay, @UNESCO Goodwill Ambassador @herbiehancock reflects on jazz as a force for peace, dialogue & unity. https://t.co/Ioy40fu4rp

"My life is jazz. Music unites people & brings them some joy.”

-- 89-year-old Holocaust survivor Simon Gronowski plays jazz from his window to lift spirits during the pandemic. Read his inspiring story on Friday's #JazzDay: https://t.co/iipg7Q0IqR 

https://t.co/3jS9JKJCG3

On Friday's #JazzDay, join us for a virtual concert hosted by UN Messenger of Peace Michael Douglas that features a historic lineup of performances by some of the 🌎’s greatest jazz masters.

🎷 Watch it live at 5pm EDT: https://t.co/RhJegshkbS https://t.co/eDI3KVrdAc

As a devastating wave of #COVID19 cases grips India, UN colleagues are among those struggling with the mental & physical impacts of the virus. 

Read this first-person account of how this viscous surge of infections has brought out the best of humanity.  https://t.co/975HCm0gIz

Friday's International #JazzDay is an opportunity to celebrate the power of jazz as a universal language of freedom to promote mutual understanding, tolerance and solidarity. https://t.co/fHiDtL8gfP https://t.co/ArXROphvmH

"We live in precarious times, and we need to be thinking about how the poorest of the poor are putting food on the table on a day to day basis."

@WFP's Marcus Prior says that in Myanmar more than 3 million people could fall into food insecurity. https://t.co/L3NU1HL64x https://t.co/VjtMVF9r1P

"My agenda is strictly to fight for the security & well-being of the Cypriots - of the Greek Cypriots & the Turkish Cypriots - that deserve to live in peace & prosperity together."

-- @antonioguterres stresses on Thursday, following meeting on Cyprus. https://t.co/P8i3s2Hell

🎶 Jazz brings people & cultures together - and can provide comfort at difficult moments. 

More from @UNESCO on Friday's International #JazzDay: https://t.co/3ajIMFyH1D https://t.co/6RtNqQ8pta

"We will only see our way out of this pandemic the way we entered it, together. Right now, families in India need our support."

-- @UNICEFChief urges solidarity as India faces devastating #COVID19 surge. https://t.co/CRMZ4Jw5KH https://t.co/Esoj0W780U

Our Verified initiative, which has helped spread trusted information, life-saving advice & stories from the best of humanity is a @TheWebbyAwards nominee! 

Vote for the #Webbys People’s Voice award here: 
https://t.co/ga9HUaAnx1 https://t.co/nPinrJlxhe

From Colombia to Somalia to Yemen, the UN continues to help communities around the world through the #COVID19 crisis.

See examples in our latest @TwitterMoments:
https://t.co/N02SFHQZlH

1 in 4 people in high-income countries have received a #COVID19 vaccine. 
Compared with just 1 in 500 in countries with lower incomes.

#OnlyTogether can we end this pandemic - by sharing the vaccine fairly around the world. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/m6pagadbtc

#COVID19 could lead to the first decline in human development in 30 years.

Recovery policies focused on social protection, green economy & digitalization could reduce the pandemic's impact & help countries build back better.

More from @UNDP: https://t.co/j7qTmCtvxL #GlobalGoals https://t.co/0pUtFOK8CX

It's Vaccination Week in the Americas, where 6⃣ preventable diseases have been eliminated thanks to immunizations.

#VaccinesWork and can bring us closer to the people & moments we care about the most. 

More from @pahowho: https://t.co/JuFLHUPj1F https://t.co/sMiCTt0G8v

"If this highly internationalized conflict is to move towards resolution, we need a more constructive & comprehensive international diplomacy on Syria to try to unlock progress step by step."

-- @UNEnvoySyria to Security Council. https://t.co/eV8Ks0Gt35

India: UN providing critical equipment and supplies to central and state governments to help country fight rapid #COVID19 surge.
https://t.co/E2Qb2TS005

More #WomenInPeacekeeping = more perspectives & solutions in a crisis.

See how the @ElsieFund works to promote women's meaningful participation in @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/yFKhoNbNve https://t.co/n265VW1vgo

"Access to reliable information is more than just a basic human right – it can also be a matter of life and death."

-- @antonioguterres welcomes efforts to create an international fund to secure the long-term future of independent media organizations. https://t.co/Opdq2soqw3 https://t.co/ixd4pnXeqf

Myanmar: Fresh clashes between the country's security forces & regional armed groups displace thousands, says @UNOCHA.

Humanitarians are providing emergency assistance despite operational & security challenges. https://t.co/2eL0ZoOExS

Investigative journalist & media executive @mariaressa of the Philippines to receive the 2021 @UNESCO / Guillermo Cano World Press Freedom Prize for her work defending freedom of expression. https://t.co/Js04wbfQVh

By the time a famine is declared, it will be too late for too many.
Humanitarians around the world are calling on leaders to provide the necessary resources to #FightFamine & save lives. https://t.co/LtmJF2JT4U

https://t.co/EHs2h8jHts

#COVID19 has had a devastating impact on the well-being of workers.

On Wednesday's Safety & Health at Work Day, @ILO is calling for action & investment to build a better, more resilient future of work. https://t.co/cjDG3wUVZ5

https://t.co/NNSJTPDQtp

Public interest media is helping to counter misinformation amid #COVID19.

It also helps strengthen democratic accountability & can contribute to the #GlobalGoals.

More ahead of Wednesday's UN-hosted event on protecting journalism during the pandemic. https://t.co/Ps9j7Z9Kol https://t.co/I7APIdqc7a

Nurses
doctors
teachers
journalists
sanitation & grocery store workers...

On Wednesday's Safety & Health at Work Day, we salute the courage, commitment & heroic efforts of all workers on the front lines of the fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/Zgj2gF9iLZ

🎨: Chiara Fiori https://t.co/sHUQh0JDO7

Ensuring respect for international humanitarian law is the first step towards protecting civilians & critical infrastructure during conflict, @UNReliefChief tells Security Council. https://t.co/EXhQtWDrib

We can all help promote better safety & health practices in the workplace to reduce the number of injuries & deaths.

Wednesday is World Day for Safety & Health at Work. https://t.co/Zgj2gF9iLZ https://t.co/CbutRb3krY

Informal meetings underway in Geneva to explore likelihood of reaching negotiated solution to decades of tensions in Cyprus.

@antonioguterres realistic about the challenges, but hopeful parties will approach meetings with creativity & sincerity. https://t.co/XdkqRIbS2A

2021 is a crucial year for decisive #ClimateAction. 

Protecting our planet is in everyone's interest & everyone has a role to play.

See how you can #ActNow to help build a more sustainable world: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/pnPLQ57slC

The #COVID19 pandemic has fundamentally changed how people learn, work & access basic services.

On Tuesday, #UNGA will meet to discuss how to ensure no one is left behind amid this digital transformation. 
https://t.co/mXiJx6ab8e https://t.co/dVJUINu2QH

"We decided what more can we do instead of just sitting on the sidelines and complaining." 

Meet @UNEP Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee. She's a Kenyan engineer who is turning trash into cash by recycling plastic waste into building materials. https://t.co/aijwzQsuUb https://t.co/Ze5p7stJjC

"Living life solely through a screen has been heartbreaking for many young people, especially those with existing mental health issues." 

-- UN communications chief @MelissaFleming shares her concerns about the devastating impact of #COVID19 on youth.

After circumnavigating Africa's biggest lake for the last month, a boat constructed entirely of recycled plastic is shining a light on how we can #BeatPlasticPollution for #CleanSeas.

More on @theflipflopi's inspirational voyage 👇 https://t.co/2Iauz49kER

Millions of children have missed their routine vaccinations since the beginning of the pandemic.

New UN-led global immunization initiative aims to protect everyone, everywhere, against preventable diseases & save over 50 million lives. https://t.co/zG9RJMOq76 https://t.co/yyDCF6fBoQ

Rescuers are searching for survivors of a shipwreck off Venezuela. The boat was heading to Trinidad & Tobago. 

@UNmigration & @Refugees warn that amid #COVID19, people are increasingly undertaking dangerous, life-threatening journeys by sea. https://t.co/spcfgVkpsz

As the largest global gathering on indigenous issues continues, a new @UN4Indigenous virtual exhibit is showcasing the rich diversity of indigenous peoples & their cultures. https://t.co/yri0HfQ57F #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/G25o4Yze3M

Forests provide for & protect us by:
cleaning the air 🌳
protecting biodiversity 🐝
regulating our climate ☀️

The UN Forests Forum meets this week to discuss solutions for protecting & restoring our forests. 🌳🌴🌲 https://t.co/VHuAz4I0YP https://t.co/1G2keASQjt

Ideas, ingenuity & expertise are key to running a successful business – but intellectual property can take you even further.

Learn more from @WIPO on Monday's #WorldIPDay: https://t.co/OYCwvynbqp https://t.co/VTCBcPIKFK

Even as many of us are staying close to home due to #COVID19, young people around the world are taking #ClimateAction online. 

See how you can join them: https://t.co/kVmOnBk7Q7 via @UNICEF https://t.co/AnSHjVfjy6

Intellectual property rights play a key role in helping small and medium-sized enterprises build stronger, more competitive businesses.

@WIPO explains how on Monday's #WorldIPDay: https://t.co/OYCwvynbqp https://t.co/95fDMIHviG

Monday is International Chernobyl Disaster Remembrance Day. 

The women, men & children affected by radioactive contamination must never be forgotten. https://t.co/NgFHwSPHkY https://t.co/SHZ3w2tLBS

To achieve a gender-equal media industry, we need more films...
✍️ written by women
🎬 directed by women
📽️ produced by women
👩🏿 about women

#Oscars via @UN_Women https://t.co/rKScGyMOy1

Every 2 minutes a child dies of malaria. 

Alongside efforts to tackle #COVID19, @WHO is urging countries to ensure that other killer disease, such as malaria, are safely treated.

More on Sunday's #WorldMalariaDay: https://t.co/ezB6yNGSpy https://t.co/QYOl8sLt3l

Vaccines are safe & help prevent millions of deaths every year. 

This World Immunization Week, learn how #VaccinesWork from @WHO. https://t.co/egdYXyfEMc https://t.co/VtrYPoM1Ps

🦟 Simple steps can help protect you from the risks posed by mosquitoes, including malaria. 

Check out some prevention tips from @WHO on Sunday's #WorldMalariaDay: https://t.co/k7qOy20Lgc https://t.co/CxDctCWWWV

It's #Oscars Sunday! 

Did you know that the UN-produced film “First Steps”, focusing on children with disabilities, won an Academy Award in 1947? 

Watch it here: https://t.co/P4rxTwxKLF https://t.co/ziLpQK4glv

Despite some successes, global progress to #EndMalaria has levelled off in recent years, with #COVID19 posing additional challenges.

Latest @WHO report calls for increased funding, access to health services & investment in research & innovation. https://t.co/TcamoDnZph https://t.co/heGzCQ9tzJ

Despite #COVID19 & other serious global challenges, the UN has continued working with delegates from around the world to ensure that all people can live in peace, dignity & equality on a healthy planet.

Sunday is International Delegates Day. https://t.co/Wt3s6JS7Lz https://t.co/iFWwyHcCF4

🌡2020 was 1 of the 3 warmest years on record, with:
🧊ice sheets melting,
💧ocean heat at record levels,
🔥wildfires, 🌊flooding, 🌀hurricanes & more all pointing to the urgent need for #ClimateAction.

More from @WMO: https://t.co/jvYHpk6rz4 https://t.co/aDLm4jojz7

Preventing genocide requires early action to protect those at risk.

Find out about the Genocide Convention & its role in combating & preventing the crime of genocide: https://t.co/ydEOmKvSO3 https://t.co/fhSb06ycG0

"I know everything I do makes a difference in a positive way."

@UNMAS's Paul Heslop joined @MelissaFleming on Awake At Night to talk about his fascinating 30-year career clearing mines so people don't have to be afraid of their next step. https://t.co/EZtmnJqRGu https://t.co/owX9EXtBXP

The distribution of #COVID19 vaccines around the world has shed new light on the invaluable role of vaccines in keep people safe & healthy. 

More from @UNICEF on why #VaccinesWork, as World Immunization Week gets underway. https://t.co/rmykFbm3Aj

On Saturday's #DiplomacyDay & every day, the UN works for "we the peoples" by:
 • responding to #COVID19
 • #ServingForPeace 
 • taking #ClimateAction 
 • working for the #GlobalGoals

... and much more. https://t.co/gjJwuPtXgi https://t.co/0t3xq6FUoz

"We need strong multilateral action now, to emerge from the pandemic safely, to address the climate crisis, and to build stronger, safer communities & societies."

-- @antonioguterres on Saturday's #DiplomacyDay.  https://t.co/m5lDVBIlek https://t.co/Hz1Fmid10T

Climate change is a menace to our world. 

Our league of superheroes is taking #ClimateAction and they want YOU to join them! 

Get to know them all and find out how you can #ActNow: https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC https://t.co/Iv3GIeDhJB

"Young people have played a crucial role in mobilizing societies & pushing governments towards bold, urgent #ClimateAction."

Ahead of this week's #EarthDay, @antonioguterres talked to @KoloMarie 🇲🇬 & @pcopaloma 🇧🇷 about the need to protect our planet. https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/vqMRa8NBhd

Disarmament is 🗝️ to help create sustainable peace & security for all.

In the Central African Republic, 1,500+ small arms were destroyed this month as part of @UN_CAR's community violence reduction programme.

More on the vital work of @UNpeacekeeping: https://t.co/e0yDHjy49N https://t.co/3SRrI3Z9CT

Books have the ability to transport the mind & captivate the soul.

For millions forced to physically isolate during the #COVID19 pandemic, books have provided both pleasure & comfort. 

More from @UNESCO on Friday's #WorldBookDay: https://t.co/1uAUTRc7wK https://t.co/JuCUYAUz3F

"Only when everyone everywhere is vaccinated will we get out of this pandemic."

-- UN communications chief @MelissaFleming talks to @WebMD's @drjohnwhyte about how #OnlyTogether we can end the #COVID19 crisis & get back to the things & people we love. https://t.co/rLQMp44SZw https://t.co/00U4V1Ae6Z

Books can help combat poverty, strengthen peace & achieve the #GlobalGoals.

Friday's #WorldBookDay is an opportunity to celebrate the power of the written word. https://t.co/1uAUTRc7wK via @UNESCO https://t.co/kvmpyyFICc

¡Feliz Día del Idioma Español! 

Happy Spanish Language Day! 

Spanish is one of the UN's six official languages. Follow @ONU_es to see our social media updates in Spanish. 👇 https://t.co/TuE1xdjizb

English is one of the 2 working languages and 6 official languages of the United Nations. 

Friday is English Language Day: https://t.co/BQ5xNR3e2G https://t.co/Nse2pE6oTw

For millions of people worldwide, books have been a source of entertainment & comfort during the #COVID19 pandemic.

Tell us about your favourite reads on Friday's #WorldBookDay! https://t.co/1uAUTRc7wK https://t.co/37QN1DK3Vv

As the urgency for #ClimateAction to protect our planet keeps increasing, see how the UN joined people around the world in celebrating Thursday's #EarthDay.
https://t.co/oGlS7XfF2f
Myanmar: @WFP launches effort to provide up to 2 million people with urgent nutritional assistance amid increasing hunger & desperation due to ongoing crisis in the country. https://t.co/ORHn7z49UO

"Let us now mobilize political leadership to move ahead together – to overcome climate change, end our war on nature and build lives of dignity & prosperity for all."

-- @antonioguterres at #ClimateLeadersSummit on #EarthDay. https://t.co/Ei9m6rineD https://t.co/JL7BfAHz6k

2021 is a decisive year for ambitious #ClimateAction, and all of us can do our part - from reducing & recycling waste to driving less, to choosing zero-waste fashion.

More ideas how you can #ActNow to make every day #EarthDay: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/mNp3kz4QMD

Most of the people who lack access to digital technology are women & girls.

We must close the digital gender gap by helping them get equal access, skills & opportunities in the tech industry. 

More from @ITU on #GirlsinICT Day: https://t.co/MHponTza57 https://t.co/4em3K5StwG

"Let us all commit to the hard work of restoring our planet and making peace with nature."

On Thursday's #EarthDay, @antonioguterres calls for a sustainable recovery from #COVID19. https://t.co/fFNMfXoerD https://t.co/t7nXLFAhgL

The future of tech must be equal. 👩‍💻👨‍💻

On Thursday's #GirlsinICT Day, join @UN_Women in calling for empowering girls to pursue tech careers. https://t.co/9b1mmHprBj

5 years ago, the #ParisAgreement opened for signature. Since then, almost 200 countries have signed on to tackle the climate crisis together.

More about the international #ClimateAction treaty to limit global warming to protect people & planet: https://t.co/lL9hCtcS5q #EarthDay https://t.co/DPJ2N2TFEB
